isis.stitle: TSI 07-08-01RA - New Instrument Panel Cluster Indicators for 2008 Model Year

subjectgroup.subject: New Instrument Panel Cluster Indicators for 2008 Model Year

geninfo.para: A number of important changes to the instrument cluster have been incorporated for trucks and buses built in 2007, model year 2008.
1. The gauge sweep no longer occurs when the ignition is turned on.

note.para: For ProStar trucks equipped with the VID (Vehicle Information Display), the gauge sweep can be requested through the display.
For any vehicle not equipped with the VID, the gauge sweep will occur when the display of on-board diagnostics is requested.

geninfo.para: 2. The odometer display button is now used not only to clear resettable values (by pushing), but also to select LCD quadrants (by turning). Refer to the Operator's Manual for specific instructions.
3. The amber Driver Alert symbol has been changed to:

It can be turned on not only by the engine but also by other modules/controllers connected to the J1939 data link. This indicator, therefore, no longer represents only an engine alert condition. To correctly identify the actual alert condition, a text message in quadrant 2 of the LCD will be displayed.

figure.caption: Figure 1. NOTE: Functions of the 4 quadrant LCD are described in the operator's manual.

geninfo.para: 4. The red stop symbol has been changed to:
This indicator can also be turned on by multiple modules/controllers, similar to the Amber Driver Alert. Quadrant 2 will display a text message identifying the source.
5. The amber emissions system warning symbol has been changed to:
6. A new indicator for High Exhaust System Temperature (HEST) has been added.

This IS NOT an indication of engine overheat. This indicator warns the driver that the exhaust temperature is high. It will come on because of NORMAL passive or active regeneration or exhaust high temperature duty cycles. The HEST lamp will come on if exhaust temperature is 400°C+ and vehicle speed is less than 5 mph. This condition is NORMAL and is not related to an engine or cooling system overheat condition.

note.para: Please refer to the pdf for this TSI for the explanation of the DPF gauge and symbol readings as the truck goes through preparation for and during regeneration to clear the emissions in the system.
